results.title: A.I. Poses ‘Risk of Extinction,’ Industry Leaders Warn
results.abstract: Leaders from OpenAI, Google DeepMind, Anthropic and other A.I. labs warn that future systems could be as deadly as pandemics and nuclear weapons.

media.caption: Executives from three of the leading A.I. companies, including Sam Altman, chief executive of OpenAI, have signed an open letter warning of the risks of artificial intelligence.

results.title: Stony Brook University to Receive $500 Million, an Uncommonly Large Gift

results.title: No One Knows How Many L.G.B.T.Q. Americans Die by Suicide
results.abstract: Death investigators in Utah are among a handful of groups trying to learn how many gay and transgender people die by suicide in the United States.

results.title: Talk of Racism Proves Thorny for G.O.P. Candidates of Color
results.abstract: As candidates like Tim Scott and Nikki Haley bolster their biographies with stories of discrimination, they have often denied the existence of systemic racism in America while describing situations that sound just like it.

results.title: Whitney Museum Sells Breuer Building to Sotheby’s for About $100 Million
results.abstract: The auction house will make the Brutalist icon on Madison Avenue its flagship in 2025.

media.caption: The Whitney Museum has sold the landmark building designed by the great Bauhaus architect Marcel Breuer to Sotheby’s auction house. After moving to the Meatpacking District, the Whitney leased the Brutalist building to the Metropolitan Museum of Art and the Frick.
